title: What if the Western Roman Empire had survived, while the Eastern empire fell? - Quora

Although Byzantium continued after 476 C.E. it really never retained the aura of Roman Empire, mostly due to it not being in Europe proper. The entire Blessing of the Barbarians being allowed to take-over the Western Empire had to do with the intent for Catholicism to hijack the Empire in favor of a “Holy Roman Empire” - which it actually did achieve by 800 C.E. and which came to and end in 1800. The only thing that can be concluded is; if Western Rome fell that Christianity would resemble the original Gnostic form, over the Paulian Resurrection Type promoted by the Vaticanized Catholic Christianity. If this were the case, we would not have had a Catholic type christianity in Europe - most likely would not have had a Vatican, and Christianity would have been the religion of the teachings of Jesus and not the promotion of Resurrection God teaching which originated with Paul.
